comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: More detail on the German Concession of Kiautschou (1898-1914) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiautschou_Bay_concession "The Siege of Tsingtao was the attack on the German-controlled port of Tsingtao (now Qingdao) in China during World War I by Imperial Japan and the United Kingdom. It took place between 31 October and 7 November 1914 and was fought by Imperial Japan and the United Kingdom against Germany. It was the first encounter between Japanese and German forces, and also the first Anglo-Japanese operation during the war." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Tsingtao The Germans surrendered the Concession to the Allies on November, 16, 1914

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for this information. We'll add some of it to the record the next time we update.
